resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13203:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13203#issuecomment-1132842962

   :warning: Ticket **has not been started in JIRA**, please click 'Start Progress'.

kou commented on PR #13203:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13203#issuecomment-1133777285

   > Did you validate that it fixes the issue?
   
   Partially, yes. I just confirmed that C++ uses UTF-8 instead of not the current code page but didn't confirm for PyArrow.
   
   I used `$BUILD_DIR/DEBUG/arrow-file-to-stream.exe XXX` to confirm this. It outputs `Could not convert to stream: IOError: Failed to open local file 'xxx'. Detail: [Windows error 2] 指定されたファイルが見つかりません。` on Japanese Windows. The output encoding was changed to UTF-8 from ShiftJIS (the current code page on Japanese Windows) with this change.

pitrou commented on PR #13203:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13203#issuecomment-1141058166

   https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13263 should fix the AppVeyor failure.

pitrou commented on PR #13203:

   Now rebased.

pitrou closed pull request #13203: ARROW-16617: [C++] Add support for multi-byte system error message on Windows
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13203

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
The {{WinErrorMessage}} utility function calls {{FormatMessageA}} in order to get the Windows error message. This unfortunately returns the message encoded using the current "codepage", which can give unreadable results if there are non-ASCII characters in it.

Instead, we should probably use {{FormatMessageW}} and then convert to UTF-8. At least  {{PyArrow}} expects the error message in a {{Status}} to be utf8-encoded.
fields.summary: [C++] WinErrorMessage() should not use Windows ANSI APIs

comments.body: [~kou] Would you by chance have a Windows install in a non-European language so as we can test the localized error messages there?
I can do it. I'll submit a pull request later.
